definition: to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: This almost-falling into chaos keeps life proliferating.
sentences.chinese: 这种几近坠落乃至混沌的运行状态确保了生命的增殖。

sentences.english: I crash-landed on a strange planet.
sentences.chinese: 我坠落在一个奇怪的星球。

sentences.english: Four US copters have gone down in Iraq in recent weeks.
sentences.chinese: 近几周来，已经有四架美军直升机在伊拉克坠落。

sentences.english: Some nice wooden houses like the stars drop on the edges of the fjord.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小木屋像点点繁星坠落在峡湾两翼。

sentences.english: The plane was heavily damaged in crash on take-off.
sentences.chinese: 飞机在起飞时坠落，遭到严重损坏。

sentences.english: Rosat (DLR)A big German spacecraft has made an uncontrolled fall from the sky.
sentences.chinese: 一架大型德国飞船失去控制，从天空中坠落下来。

sentences.english: Oslash; Prime and Megatron lost on Earth.
sentences.chinese: 擎天柱与威震天一同坠落地球。

sentences.english: And he has fallen like Lucifer, never to rise again.
sentences.chinese: 他儿时的梦想象晓星一样坠落，注定不会再度升起。

sentences.english: To study the difference of the regularity and characteristics between traffic accident trauma and high fall injury.
sentences.chinese: 研究交通事故与高空坠落致伤规律及特点的差异。
我们向你致敬，坠落熊2号。

sentences.english: Breakables or heavy objects that are kept on high or open shelves.
sentences.chinese: 放置在开放架或高处的易碎品或重物可能坠落。

sentences.english: The perfume represented prewar decadence, glamour and good times in a bottle.
sentences.chinese: 香水代表战前的坠落，魅力和美好时光。

sentences.english: The star could rain down from the heavens now and I would not care.
sentences.chinese: 现在哪怕落星如雨，自天堂坠落，我也不在乎。

sentences.english: The bright stars, son of the morning! How art thou, and fall from heaven?
sentences.chinese: 明亮之星，早晨之子啊，你何竟从天上坠落？

sentences.english: Their bodies were spotted at the foot of the cliffs on Sunday evening and were recovered on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 周日晚上，他们的尸体坠落在崖脚，周一被人收敛。

sentences.english: The sunshine falls casually, all the slight brightness are floating in the room.
sentences.chinese: 阳光不经意间坠落，一室的清辉便浮动起来。

definition: to fall off or jump off a building
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
